item.title: Deborah add a quote by Ngugi wa Thiong'o
item.description: "She fought life with dreams." -- Ngugi wa Thiong'o

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Cherie Priest
item.description: "It was a train full of strangers, and they were all the same." -- Cherie Priest

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Cherie Priest
item.description: "And people tended not to bother a woman with a book." -- Cherie Priest

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Penelope Fitzgerald
item.description: "Behind their dark glass, the mad own nothing." -- Penelope Fitzgerald

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Terri Windling
item.description: "Fairy tales were not my escape from reality as a child; rather, they were my reality -- for mine was a world in which good and evil were not abstract concepts, and like fairy-tale heroines, no magic would save me unless I had the wit and heart and courage to use it widely." -- Terri Windling

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Good evening, gentlemen!' said the vampire. 'Please pay attention. I am a <i>reformed</i> vampire, which is to say, I am a bundle of repressed instincts held together with spit and coffee. It would be wrong to say that violent, tearing carnage does not come easily to me. It's <i>not</i> tearing your throats out that doesn't come easily to me. Please don't make it any harder." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "The true secret in being a hero lies in knowing the order of things. The swineherd cannot already be wed to the princess when he embarks on his adventures, nor can the boy knock on the witch's door when she is already away on vacation. The wicked uncle cannot be found out and foiled before he does something wicked. Things must happen when it is time for them to happen. Quests may not simply be abandoned; prophecies may not be left to rot like unpicked fruit; unicorns may go unrescued for a very long time, but not forever. The happy ending cannot come in the middle of the story." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "Readers will always insist on adventures, and though you can have grief without adventures, you cannot have adventures without grief." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Deborah add a quote by Harry Dresden
item.description: "Tao of Pratchett. I live by it." -- Harry Dresden
